result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

03:15 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DE: Daniel John Craven-LaPean pro se. Court questions DE regarding non-appearance from 3/9. DE states that he didn't know he missed Court. Court quashes stayed warrant. ADA Ellenwood requests good cause for prelim time limits, notes Atty. Davis is assigned to DE's other pending case. Court finds good cause to extend prelim time limits, if DE qualifies - Atty. Davis will be appointed. Court sets PTC. Adjourned: 3:21 PM. kma  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 03:45 pm. OFF RECORD: DE completed PFAC, sworn in by Court. Court approves PFAC and appoints Atty. Davis.
Return on warrant on March 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

DE did appear in another case in Branch I this morning. ADA Ellenwood request warrant stayed until Friday. Court Issues Warrant- Stayed until 03/16/22. Adjourned 04:25 PM  Return on warrant scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Filed by DA's office. mw
Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Bail/bond hearing on March 9, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

- No possession or use of dangerous weapons

- Defendant to reside with mother

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.Temple and N.Temple.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
